tool.name: Bowtie2
tool.command:
bash ${__tool_directory__}/01_bowtie2-index.sh '$genomeSequence';
## Bowtie2 alignment bowtie2 -p ${thread} #if $algorithm_options.algorithm_options_selector == "advanced": #if $algorithm_options.pre_sets.local_or_end_to_end == "end_to_end": #if $algorithm_options.pre_sets.modes == "sensitive": --sensitive #elif $algorithm_options.pre_sets.modes == "very_fast": --very-fast #elif $algorithm_options.pre_sets.modes == "fast": --fast #else: --very-sensitive #end if #elif $algorithm_options.pre_sets.local_or_end_to_end == "local": #if $algorithm_options.pre_sets.modes == "sensitive_local": --sensitive-local #elif $algorithm_options.pre_sets.modes == "very_fast_local": --very-fast-local #elif $algorithm_options.pre_sets.modes == "fast_local": --fast-local #else: --very-sensitive-local #end if #else: -D $algorithm_options.pre_sets.give_up -R $algorithm_options.pre_sets.repetitive -N $algorithm_options.pre_sets.max_mismatches -L $algorithm_options.pre_sets.seed_length -i $algorithm_options.pre_sets.interval --n-ceil $algorithm_options.pre_sets.func --dpad $algorithm_options.pre_sets.extra_ref_chars --gbar $algorithm_options.pre_sets.disallow_gaps #end if #end if -x '$genomeSequence' #if $fqType.single_or_paired == "single": -U '$readSE' #elif $fqType.single_or_paired == "paired": -1 '$readR1' -2 '$readR2' #end if -S '$alignmentOutput' 2>$alignmentSummary;

param.name: give_up
param.label: give up extending after # failed extends in a row

param.name: repetitive
param.label: for reads w/ repetitive seeds, try # sets of seeds

param.name: interval
param.label: Interval between seed substrings w/r/t read len

param.name: func
param.label: Func for max # non-A/C/G/Ts permitted in aln

param.name: extra_ref_chars
param.label: include # extra ref chars on sides of DP table

param.name: disallow_gaps
param.label: disallow gaps within # nucs of read extremes

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Bowtie2_ is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences. It is particularly good at aligning reads of about 50 up to 100s or 1,000s of characters to relatively long (e.g. mammalian) genomes. Bowtie 2 supports gapped, local, and paired-end alignment modes. Galaxy wrapper for Bowtie 2 outputs alignments in `BAM format`_, enabling interoperation with a large number of other tools available at this site. Majority of information in this page is derived from an excellent `Bowtie2 manual`_ written by Ben Langmead.
.. _Bowtie2: http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/ .. _`Bowtie2 manual`: http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/manual.shtml .. _`BAM format`: http://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/SAMv1.pdf
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
- **FASTQ format sequencing files** - **Reference genome in FASTA format**
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
- Alignments in BAM format - Alignment summary generated by bowtie2
